wikipedia_page.main: Jacob Thomas VC (February 1833 – 3 March 1911) was a Welsh recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *3 March - Jacob Thomas, Victoria Cross recipient, 78
* 3 March – Jacob Thomas, Victoria Cross recipient (born 1833)
* Jacob Thomas (VC) (1833–1911), British Victoria Cross recipient
* Jacob Thomas (police officer) (born 1960), Indian Police Service

**Sergeant Bernard Diamond, Gunner Richard Fitzgerald, Lieutenant Hastings Edward Harrington, Lieutenant James Hills-Johnes, Rough Rider Edward Jennings, Gunner Thomas Laughnan, Gunner Hugh McInnes, Captain William Olpherts, Gunner James Park, Captain George Alexander Renny, Lieutenant Frederick Roberts, Bombardier Jacob Thomas, Lieutenant Colonel Henry Tombs, Major Richard Keatinge.
